narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to handle camera/sound equipment, video editing software, as well as pre/postproduction common practices.

This course teaches you how to direct a short film from scratch. Everything from drafting a screenplay to drawing storyboards is covered. You truly learn a lot through the course and people in class learn to collaborate together. Plus, Professor Andrews sincerely cares about his students.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: Professor Andrews is a wonder professor, his feedback is thorough and well thought out. Lectures can also be entertaining, there's definitely a sense of community in this class. 

Weaknesses: The length of each class can drag on. I think the system could be streamlined a bit so that we all watch each other's work outside of class and offer our comments during.

The strength would definitely be the sheer growth I went through as a filmmaker. In the highly collaborative, productive environment that Prof Andrews made, the creative process flowed better than ever. I have a better understanding not only on technical logistics and terms, but also have gained the ability to look at the bigger picture and make strategic/stylistic decisions that shape the entire film. The only weakness would be the time frame--the class does feel very long, especially under the zoom format. I guess this is inevitable since it is a production class, but I think it may be better if divided into two days.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Being able to actually learn and still shoot was a huge success.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, I'd recommend this to anyone who's curious about filmmaking and committed to taking the intermediate course.
If you are an aspiring filmmaker, you must take this course.
